00030 using namespace std;
00031 
00032 typedef struct {
00033   string name;
00034   uint32_t base;
00035   uint32_t size;
00036 }module_info_t;
00037 
00038 typedef struct {
00039   uint32_t cr3;
00040   uint32_t pid;
00041   string name;
00042   list<module_info_t *> module_list; //we make sure the list is sorted
00043 }process_info_t;
00044 
00045 static list<process_info_t *> process_list;
00046 
00047 createproc_notify_t createproc_notify=NULL;
00048 removeproc_notify_t removeproc_notify=NULL;
00049 loadmodule_notify_t loadmodule_notify=NULL;
00050 
00051 // MIN: process tracking...
00052 loadmainmodule_notify_t loadmainmodule_notify = NULL;
00053 
00054 int insert_module_info(list<module_info_t *> &module_list, const char *name, 
00055           uint32_t base, uint32_t size)
00056 {
00057   module_info_t *mod = new module_info_t();
00058   module_info_t *mod2;
00059   if (mod == NULL)
00060     return -1;
00061 
00062   mod->name = name;
00063   mod->base = base;
00064   mod->size = size;
00065 
00066   list<module_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00067   for (iter = module_list.begin(); iter != module_list.end(); iter++) {
00068     mod2 = *iter;
00069     if (mod2->base > base)
00070       break;
00071 
00072     if (mod2->base + mod2->size > base) {
00073       //there is overlapped region
00074       iter = module_list.erase(iter);
00075       iter--; 
00076       delete mod2;
00077     }
00078   }
00079   module_list.insert(iter, mod);
00080   return 0;
00081 }
00082 
00083 int procmod_insert_modinfo(uint32_t pid, uint32_t cr3, const char *name,
00084                            uint32_t base, uint32_t size)
00085 {
00086   list<process_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00087   process_info_t *proc;
00088 
00089   for (iter = process_list.begin(); iter!=process_list.end(); iter++) {
00090     proc = *iter;
00091     if (proc->pid == pid) {
00092       if (proc->name.length() == 0) {
00093         //first loaded module is the main executable
00094         proc->cr3 = cr3;
00095         proc->name = name;
00096 
00097     // MIN: process tracking...
00098     // the main moduled is being loaded.
00099     if (loadmainmodule_notify != NULL)
00100           loadmainmodule_notify(pid, (char*)name);
00101       }
00102       break;
00103     }
00104   }
00105 
00106   if (iter == process_list.end()) //pid not found
00107     return -1;
00108 
00109   insert_module_info(proc->module_list, name, base, size);
00110   return 0;
00111 }
00112 
00113 
00114 int procmod_createproc(uint32_t pid, uint32_t cr3, const char *name)
00115 {
00116   list<process_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00117   process_info_t *proc = new process_info_t();
00118   if (proc == NULL)
00119     return -1;
00120 
00121   proc->pid = pid;
00122   proc->cr3 = cr3;
00123   proc->name = name;
00124 
00125   for (iter = process_list.begin(); iter != process_list.end(); iter++) {
00126     process_info_t *aproc = *iter;
00127     if (aproc->pid > pid)
00128       break;
00129   }
00130 
00131   process_list.insert(iter, proc);
00132   if(createproc_notify) createproc_notify(pid, cr3);
00133 
00134   return 0;
00135 }
00136 
00137 int procmod_removeproc(uint32_t pid)
00138 {
00139   if(removeproc_notify) removeproc_notify(pid);
00140 
00141   list<process_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00142   process_info_t *proc;
00143   module_info_t *mod;
00144 
00145   for (iter = process_list.begin(); iter != process_list.end(); iter++) {
00146     proc = *iter;
00147     if (proc->pid == pid) {
00148 
00149       while (!proc->module_list.empty()) {
00150         mod = proc->module_list.front();
00151         proc->module_list.pop_front();
00152         delete mod;
00153       }
00154   
00155       process_list.erase(iter);
00156 //      remove_threads_by_cr3(cr3);
00157       delete proc;
00158       break;
00159     }
00160   }
00161   return 0;
00162 }
00163 
00164 
00165 static int procmod_remove_all()
00166 {
00167   process_info_t *proc;
00168   module_info_t *mod;
00169 
00170   while (!process_list.empty()) {
00171     proc = process_list.front();
00172     while (!proc->module_list.empty()) {
00173       mod = proc->module_list.front();
00174       proc->module_list.pop_front();
00175       delete mod;
00176     }
00177 
00178     process_list.pop_front();
00179     delete proc;
00180   }
00181   return 0;
00182 }
00183 
00184 
00185 int update_proc(void *opaque)
00186 {
00187 //    long taskaddr = 0xC033C300; 
00188   int pid;
00189   uint32_t cr3, pgd, mmap;
00190   uint32_t nextaddr = 0;
00191 
00192   char comm[512];
00193 
00194   procmod_remove_all();
00195 
00196   nextaddr = taskaddr;
00197   do {
00198     pid = get_pid(nextaddr);
00199     pgd = get_pgd(nextaddr); 
00200     cr3 = pgd - 0xc0000000;  //subtract a page offset 
00201     get_name(nextaddr, comm, 512);
00202     procmod_createproc(pid, cr3, comm);
00203 
00204     mmap = get_first_mmap(nextaddr);
00205     while (0 != mmap) {
00206       get_mod_name(mmap, comm, 512);
00207       //term_printf("0x%08lX -- 0x%08lX %s\n", get_vmstart(env, mmap),
00208       //            get_vmend(env, mmap), comm); 
00209       int base = get_vmstart(mmap); 
00210       int size = get_vmend(mmap) - get_vmstart(mmap);
00211       procmod_insert_modinfo(pid, pgd, comm, base, size);
00212       
00213       char message[612]; 
00214       snprintf(message, sizeof(message), "M %d %x \"%s\" %x %d", pid, pgd, comm, base, size); 
00215       handle_message(message); 
00216 
00217       char funcfile[128]; 
00218       snprintf(funcfile, 128, "/tmp/%s.func", comm); 
00219       FILE *fp = fopen(funcfile, "r");
00220       if (fp) {
00221     while (!feof(fp)) {
00222         int offset; 
00223         char fname[128]; 
00224         if (fscanf(fp, "%x %128s", &offset, fname) == 2) {
00225       snprintf(message, 128, "F %s %s %x ", comm, 
00226          fname, offset); 
00227       handle_message(message); 
00228         }
00229     }
00230     fclose(fp); 
00231       }
00232 
00233       mmap = get_next_mmap(mmap);
00234 
00235     }
00236 
00237     nextaddr = next_task_struct(nextaddr);
00238 
00239   } while (nextaddr != taskaddr);
00240 
00241   return 0;
00242 }
00243 
00244 
00245 void procmod_cleanup()
00246 {
00247   procmod_remove_all();
00248 //  remove_all_threads();
00249   deregister_savevm("procmod", 0);
00250 }

00254 static tmodinfo_t *find_module_byeip(uint32_t eip, list<module_info_t *> &module_list)
00255 {
00256   static tmodinfo_t mi;
00257 
00258   list<module_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00259   for (iter = module_list.begin(); iter != module_list.end(); iter ++) {
00260     module_info_t *mod = *iter;
00261     if (mod->base <= eip && mod->size + mod->base > eip) {
00262       strncpy(mi.name, mod->name.c_str(), sizeof(mi.name)-1);
00263       mi.base = mod->base;
00264       mi.size = mod->size;
00265       return &mi;
00266     }
00267  
00268     if (mod->base > eip)
00269       break;
00270   }
00271 
00272   return NULL;
00273 }
00274 
00275 
00276 static tmodinfo_t *find_module_byname(const char *name, list<module_info_t *> &module_list)
00277 {
00278   static tmodinfo_t mi;
00279 
00280   list<module_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00281   for (iter = module_list.begin(); iter != module_list.end(); iter ++) {
00282     module_info_t *mod = *iter;
00283     if (strcasecmp(mod->name.c_str(), name) == 0) {
00284       strncpy(mi.name, mod->name.c_str(), sizeof(mi.name)-1);
00285       mi.base = mod->base;
00286       mi.size = mod->size;
00287       return &mi;
00288     }
00289   }
00290 
00291   return NULL;
00292 }

00295 
00296 tmodinfo_t *locate_module(uint32_t eip, uint32_t cr3, char *proc_name)
00297 {
00298   list<process_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00299   for (iter = process_list.begin(); iter != process_list.end(); iter++) {
00300     process_info_t *proc = *iter;
00301 
00302     //FIXME: here we hardcode the boundary of kernel memory space.
00303     //we need better solution.
00304     if(eip > 0x80000000 && proc->cr3 == 0) {
00305       strcpy(proc_name, proc->name.c_str());
00306       return find_module_byeip(eip, proc->module_list);
00307     }
00308 
00309     if (proc->cr3 == cr3) {
00310       strcpy(proc_name, proc->name.c_str());
00311       return find_module_byeip(eip, proc->module_list);
00312     }
00313   }
00314 
00315   strcpy(proc_name, "<UNKNOWN>");
00316   return NULL;
00317 }
00318 
00319 tmodinfo_t *locate_module_byname(const char *name, uint32_t pid)
00320 {
00321   list<process_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00322   for (iter = process_list.begin(); iter != process_list.end(); iter++) {
00323     process_info_t *proc = *iter;
00324 
00325     if(proc->pid == pid) {
00326       return find_module_byname(name, proc->module_list);
00327     }
00328   }
00329   return NULL;
00330 }
00331 
00332 uint32_t find_pid(uint32_t cr3) 
00333 {
00334   list<process_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00335   
00336   for (iter = process_list.begin(); iter != process_list.end(); iter++) {
00337     process_info_t * proc = *iter;
00338     if (proc->cr3 == cr3) {
00339       return proc->pid;
00340     }
00341   }
00342   return -1;
00343 }
00344 
00345 uint32_t find_pid_by_name(const char* proc_name)
00346 {
00347   list<process_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00348 
00349   for (iter = process_list.begin(); iter != process_list.end(); iter++) {
00350     process_info_t * proc = *iter;
00351     if (strcmp(proc_name,proc->name.c_str()) == 0) {
00352       return proc->pid;
00353     }
00354   }
00355   return -1;
00356 }

00359 
00360 int find_process(uint32_t cr3, char proc_name[], uint32_t * pid)
00361 {
00362   process_info_t *proc;
00363   list<process_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00364 
00365   for(iter = process_list.begin(); iter!=process_list.end(); iter++) {
00366     proc = *iter;
00367     if (proc->cr3 == cr3) {
00368       strcpy(proc_name, proc->name.c_str());
00369       *pid = proc->pid;
00370 
00371       return proc->module_list.size();
00372     }
00373   }
00374 
00375   strcpy(proc_name, "<UNKNOWN>");
00376   *pid = -1;
00377   return 0;
00378 }

00381 void list_procs()
00382 {
00383   process_info_t *proc;
00384   list<process_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00385    
00386   for (iter = process_list.begin(); iter!=process_list.end(); iter++) {
00387     proc = *iter;
00388     term_printf("%d\tcr3=0x%08x\t%s\n", proc->pid, proc->cr3,
00389                 proc->name.c_str());
00390   }
00391 }

00393 
00394 void do_linux_ps()
00395 {
00396     int pid;
00397     uint32_t pgd, mmap; 
00398     uint32_t nextaddr = 0; 
00399 
00400     char comm[512]; 
00401     
00402     if (0 == taskaddr) 
00403   init_kernel_offsets(); 
00404 
00405     nextaddr = taskaddr; 
00406     do {
00407   pid = get_pid(nextaddr); 
00408   pgd = get_pgd(nextaddr); 
00409   get_name(nextaddr, comm, 512); 
00410   
00411   term_printf("%10d  CR3=0x%08lX  %s\n", pid, pgd-0xC0000000, comm); 
00412   mmap = get_first_mmap(nextaddr); 
00413   while (0 != mmap) {
00414       get_mod_name(mmap, comm, 512); 
00415       term_printf("              0x%08lX -- 0x%08lX %s\n", 
00416       get_vmstart(mmap),
00417       get_vmend(mmap), comm); 
00418       mmap = get_next_mmap(mmap); 
00419   }
00420   
00421   nextaddr = next_task_struct(nextaddr); 
00422 
00423     } while (nextaddr != taskaddr) ;
00424 
00425     update_proc(0);
00426 }

00429 uint32_t find_cr3(uint32_t pid)
00430 {
00431   process_info_t *proc;
00432   list<process_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00433 
00434   for(iter=process_list.begin(); iter!=process_list.end(); iter++) {
00435     proc = *iter;
00436     if (proc->pid == pid)
00437       return proc->cr3;
00438   }
00439 
00440   return 0;
00441 }

00443 
00444 void get_proc_modules(uint32_t pid, old_modinfo_t mi_array[], int size)
00445 {
00446   process_info_t *proc;
00447   module_info_t *mod;
00448   list<process_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00449   list<module_info_t *>::iterator iter2;
00450   int counter = 0;
00451 
00452   for(iter=process_list.begin(); iter!=process_list.end(); iter++) {
00453     proc = *iter;
00454     if (proc->pid == pid) {
00455       for(iter2=proc->module_list.begin(), counter = 0; 
00456           iter2!=proc->module_list.end(); iter2++, counter++) {
00457         mod = *iter2;
00458         strncpy(mi_array[counter].name, mod->name.c_str(), sizeof(mi_array[0].name)-1);
00459         mi_array[counter].base = mod->base;
00460         mi_array[counter].size = mod->size;
00461       }
00462     }
00463   }
00464 }

00466 
00467 void list_guest_modules(uint32_t pid)
00468 {
00469   process_info_t *proc;
00470   module_info_t *mod;
00471   list<process_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00472 
00473   for(iter=process_list.begin(); iter!=process_list.end(); iter++) {
00474     proc = *iter;
00475     if (proc->pid == pid || proc->cr3 == 0) { //we use cr3=0 for the OS kernel modules
00476       list<module_info_t *>::iterator iter2;
00477       for(iter2=proc->module_list.begin(); iter2!=proc->module_list.end(); iter2++) {
00478         mod = *iter2;
00479         term_printf("%20s\t0x%08x\t0x%08x\n", mod->name.c_str(), mod->base, mod->size);
00480       }
00481     }    
00482   }
00483 }

00485 
00486 /* return 1 if the process needs to be dumped */
00487 int checkcr3(uint32_t cr3, uint32_t eip, uint32_t tracepid, char *name,
00488              int len, uint32_t * offset)
00489 {
00490   process_info_t *proc;
00491   list<process_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00492   module_info_t *mod;
00493   list<module_info_t *>::iterator iter2;
00494 
00495   for(iter=process_list.begin(); iter!=process_list.end(); iter++) {
00496     proc = *iter;
00497     if (proc->cr3 == cr3 && proc->pid == (uint32_t)tracepid) {
00498       for(iter2 =proc->module_list.begin(); iter2!=proc->module_list.end(); iter2++) {
00499         mod = *iter2;
00500         if (mod->base <= eip && mod->size + mod->base > eip) {
00501           strncpy(name, mod->name.c_str(), len);
00502           *offset = eip - mod->base;
00503           return 1;
00504         }
00505       }
00506     }
00507   }
00508 
00509   //not found
00510   strcpy(name, "");
00511   *offset = 0;
00512   return 0;
00513 }

00515 
00516 
00517 uint32_t get_current_tid()
00518 {
00519   uint32_t val;
00520   uint32_t tid;
00521 
00522   //This may only work with Windows XP
00523 
00524   if(!is_guest_windows())
00525     return -1;
00526  
00527   if (!TEMU_is_in_kernel()) {     // user module
00528     if (TEMU_read_mem(TEMU_cpu_segs[R_FS].base+0x18, 4, &val) != -1
00529         && TEMU_read_mem(val + 0x24, 4, &tid) != -1) 
00530       return tid;
00531   }
00532   else if (TEMU_read_mem(TEMU_cpu_segs[R_FS].base+0x124, 4, &val) != -1
00533            && TEMU_read_mem(val + 0x1F0, 4, &tid) != -1)
00534     return tid;
00535 
00536   return -1;
00537 }

00540 
00541 static void procmod_save(QEMUFile * f, void *opaque)
00542 {
00543   uint32_t len;
00544   process_info_t *proc;
00545   module_info_t *mod;
00546   list<process_info_t *>::iterator iter;
00547   list<module_info_t *>::iterator iter2;
00548 
00549   //save process information
00550   qemu_put_be32(f, process_list.size());
00551   for(iter=process_list.begin(); iter!=process_list.end(); iter++) {
00552     proc = *iter;
00553     qemu_put_be32(f, proc->pid);
00554     qemu_put_be32(f, proc->cr3);
00555     len = proc->name.length() + 1;
00556     qemu_put_be32(f, len);
00557     qemu_put_buffer(f, (uint8_t *)proc->name.c_str(), len);
00558 
00559     //save module information
00560     qemu_put_be32(f, proc->module_list.size());
00561     for(iter2=proc->module_list.begin();
00562         iter2!=proc->module_list.end(); iter2++) {
00563       mod = *iter2;
00564       len = mod->name.length() + 1;
00565       qemu_put_be32(f, len);
00566       qemu_put_buffer(f, (uint8_t*)mod->name.c_str(), len);
00567       qemu_put_be32(f, mod->base);
00568       qemu_put_be32(f, mod->size);
00569     }
00570   }
00571 
00572   qemu_put_be32(f, -1); //terminator
00573 }
00574 
00575 
00576 static int procmod_load(QEMUFile * f, void *opaque, int version_id)
00577 {
00578   uint32_t i, j, nproc, nmod, len;
00579   uint32_t base, size;
00580   char name[512];
00581   process_info_t *proc;
00582 
00583   //load process and module information
00584   procmod_remove_all();
00585 
00586   nproc = qemu_get_be32(f);
00587   for (i = 0; i < nproc; i++) {
00588     proc = new process_info_t();
00589     if (proc == NULL)
00590       return -1;
00591 
00592     proc->pid = qemu_get_be32(f);
00593     proc->cr3 = qemu_get_be32(f);
00594     len = qemu_get_be32(f);
00595     assert(len <= 512);
00596     qemu_get_buffer(f, (uint8_t*)name, len);
00597     if(name[len-1] != 0) 
00598       return -EINVAL; //last character must be zero
00599     proc->name = name;
00600     process_list.push_back(proc);
00601 
00602     nmod = qemu_get_be32(f);
00603     for (j = 0; j < nmod; j++) {
00604       len = qemu_get_be32(f);
00605       assert(len <= 512);
00606       qemu_get_buffer(f, (uint8_t *)name, len);
00607       if(name[len-1] != 0) 
00608         return -EINVAL;
00609       base = qemu_get_be32(f);
00610       size = qemu_get_be32(f);
00611       insert_module_info(proc->module_list, name, base, size);
00612     }
00613   }
00614 
00615 
00616   uint32_t terminator = qemu_get_be32(f);
00617   if(terminator != (-1UL))
00618     return -EINVAL;
00619 
00620   return 0;
00621 }
00622 
00623 int detecting_kernel(void *opaque)
00624 {
00625   int kernelentry = init_kernel_offsets();
00626   if (kernelentry != -1) {
00627     //term_printf("Linux kernel entry: %d\n", kernelentry); 
00628     for_all_hookpoints(0, 0);
00629     hookapi_hook_function(1, hookingpoint, update_proc, NULL, 0);
00630     update_proc(NULL);
00631 /*      register_hookapi(0xC01A0F1D, update_proc, NULL);  */
00632   }
00633   return 0;
00634 }
00635 
00636 int procmod_init()
00637 {
00638   procmod_createproc(0, 0, "<kernel>"); //create a virutal process for the kernel
00639 
00640   FILE *guestlog = fopen("guest.log", "r");
00641   char syslogline[512];
00642   int pos = 0;
00643   if(guestlog) {
00644     int ch;
00645     while((ch = fgetc(guestlog)) != EOF) {
00646       syslogline[pos++] = (char)ch;
00647       if(pos > 510) pos = 510;
00648       if(ch == 0xa) {
00649         syslogline[pos] = 0;
00650         handle_message(syslogline); //add entries into function map
00651         parse_process(syslogline);
00652         parse_module(syslogline);
00653         pos = 0;
00654       }
00655     }
00656     fclose(guestlog);
00657   }
00658 
00659 
00660   //TODO: save and load thread information
00661 
00662   // system is not ready yet, cannot scan, 
00663   // register for all hooking points, 
00664 
00665   for_all_hookpoints(detecting_kernel, 1);
00666   register_savevm("procmod", 0, 1, procmod_save, procmod_load, NULL);
00667   return 0;
00668 }
00669 
00670 
00671 void parse_process(char *log)
00672 {
00673   char c;
00674   uint32_t pid;
00675   if (sscanf(log, "P %c %d", &c, &pid) < 2)
00676     return;
00677   switch (c) {
00678   case '-':
00679     procmod_removeproc(pid);
00680     break;
00681   case '+':
00682     procmod_createproc(pid, 0, "");
00683     break;
00684   }
00685 }
00686 
00687 
00688 void parse_module(char *log)
00689 {
00690   uint32_t pid, cr3, base, size;
00691   char mod[512];
00692 
00693   //We try to parse a long name with spaces first. If failed, we parse in the old way, 
00694   //for backward compatibility. -Heng
00695   if (sscanf(log, "M %d %x \"%[^\"]\" %x %x", &pid, &cr3, mod, &base, &size) < 5) {
00696     if (sscanf(log, "M %d %x %s %x %x", &pid, &cr3, mod, &base, &size) < 5)
00697       return;
00698   }
00699 
00700   mod[511] = 0;
00701   procmod_insert_modinfo(pid, cr3, mod, base, size);
00702   if(loadmodule_notify) 
00703     loadmodule_notify(pid, cr3, mod, base, size);
00704 }
00705 
00706 
00707 int is_guest_windows()
00708 {
00709   //FIXME: we use a very simple hack here. Windows uses FS segment register to store 
00710   // the current process context, while Linux does not. We may need better heuristics 
00711   // when we need to support more guest systems.
00712   return (TEMU_cpu_segs[R_FS].selector != 0);
00713 }
